article_title.text: North West Property and Community in Focus

article_summary.text: Here is a community and market update for The Ponds and Kelliville Ridge. We met up with Alex Hughes from The Ponds Community. The market has picked up in Feb with my team doing close to a 1000 buyer inspections in the month.

article_text.text: There is a lot happening in Ponds and Kellyville Ridge. Autum is around the corner.

We spoke with Alex Hughes, from the Ponds and Kellyville Ridge community association about events around the community and how the association help us. The association does a lot of work to help grow a sense of belongingness, and he was gracious enough to take us through some of the activities it organises. We discussed the ‘Meet your neighbour night’ thats happening on the 23rd of March, at 7:15 PM and how it can help you know people around the neighbourhood. Everyone is welcome to join, and have a good time. It start at 7:15 PM and will only go for a couple of hours. Catch all the details in the community website Thepondscommunity.com.au . There are other, more regular, events that you can join in on as well, which are mentioned in the site. Be sure to join the weekly park run at 8 AM each Saturday - parkrun.com.au/theponds

We get question on how the market is doing around Ponds and Kellyville ridge, with the slow down in the later half of last year. The market has picked up in Feb, with around 65% auction clearance rates across sydney. My team has attended close to a 1000 buyer inspections in Feb.
On a different note, my team and I are very thankful for the recognition we received from First National in the national gala. Read more about it here.

article_summary.text: I am honoured and humbled to have been associated with 2017 Christmas Campaign to support our community.

article_text.text: It’s awfully tempting to say I (and just about everyone else) told you so as the alleged “cryptocurrencies” plunge – but there are good reasons to think this isn’t the end of this particular speculative mania.
For a start, the vast majority of crypto-trading-cards  are held by relatively few people, who therefore have a large vested interest in trying to hold a line in the virtual sand.
